discussion.content:
Ok guys so i got the answer right
Let's start by process of elimination, on OSPF we use WildCard Masks, so immediately A and D are out of the question and invalid. 
Second thing is with C, NETCONF does not use JSON, and there's a JSON on one of the lines which makes this answer invalid and the only answer left is B
<get-config> - NETCONF - XML need to be used. And of course the configuration should be ok (wildcard mask)

I guess B is the correct, as it is : <native xmlns
and C is <native json
B (or C) are correct due to the mask. There is a small part not visible which makes one question wrong (param:json instead of xml)

So remember that NETCONF was created before RESTCONF, RESTCONF works in conjunction with NETCONF it was created to basically help NETCONF, if you remember this you will make the obvious choice 6241 comes first

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the characteristics from the left onto the configuration protocols they describe on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Standardization is always good for coding. Don't need to re-invent the wheel unless needed.

Selected Answer: A
Considering all the requirements in the question A seems obvious

questions.question_text: A company must automate a set of complex changes aligned with DR testing in the network. These changes are specific, and the DR playbook will be adjusted in the future. The playbook has diverse routing and switching assets in scope as well as multiple vendor and hardware platforms. A developer will create a thin, web front-end microservice and integrate with an Open Daylight controller to push changes to the network. Which YANG model should be used?

choices.D: Use a single native vendor YANG model to minimize development time.
choices.C: Use multiple native vendor YANG models to provide code consistency.
choices.A: Use an open YANG model to allow the reuse of code and standardize the implementation across platforms.
choices.B: Develop an individualized YANG model to minimize development resources and time to market.

discussion.content:
two things to check:
1) does the subnetmask add-up?
2) correct combination of protocol and encoding? (netconf ==> XML)

The correct answer is A, it's got the right encoding (XML) plus the right subnet. 
The other answer that has a correct Subnet (Wildcard) has JSON encoding which is not supported on NETCONF, please know that get-config is a NETCONF command and this is XML output.

Watchout for answer A as the interface is left ENABLED=false, while is the same but enabled=true.

Both will work but only D will leave the ip configured AND NO SHUT the interface
